Format description: Browse and select from a list.
Informational page on a specific subject. What a detail page should do is inform the user. If the information is how to do a thing, use Guide instead.
Usually a non-HTML document such as a PDF, VPAT template, etc. Generally fixed and/or infrequently versioned.
Step-by-step instructions on a process or introduction to a topic. What a guide should do is help the user accomplish a task.
Timely supporting content that ages out of relevance quickly. Its goal is to drive users to evergreen content like guides or into browse contexts like topic pages or collections.
Bio page about an awesome human of CA. Itâ€™s goal is to be a landing page for organic web searches (i.e. Googling a name).
A formal statement of rules, organizational behavior, or principles. Systematically versioned. Usually with managerial and/or legal review.
Introductory information about a topic followed by a list of links to relevant details/information. What a topic should do is get the user to some place more relevant.
